context.en: Traditional Confucian Literati Painting Visual Grammar and Ethical Translation Guidelines (Based on the orthodox systems of Song, Yuan, Ming, and Qing literati painting, with contemporary adaptation clauses) I. Ontological Transformation Rules Primacy of Xie Hes Six Laws: Prioritize qiyun shengdong (spirit-resonance and life-movement) as the supreme principle, rejecting Western realism. Moral Morphology of Forms: Plants (pine, bamboo, plum, orchid) must adhere to the Mustard Seed Garden Manual conventions‚Äîbranches rendered in calligraphic lines (bifa technique) embodying bone structure brushwork. Human figures must be smaller than landscape elements, with drapery referencing Wu Daozis wind-blown ribbons tradition (Wu Dai Dang Feng). Facial features are suggested symbolically with minimalist strokes (yi dao bi bu dao‚Äîthe idea transcends the brush). II. Spatial Recomposition Principles Triaxial Perspective System: Apply Guo Xis Three Distances (San Yuan): High Distance (Gao Yuan) for moral authority (e.g., cliff-top academies); Deep Distance (Shen Yuan) depicts Confucian order (e.g., terraced farmlands in stratified perspective); Level Distance (Ping Yuan) conveys Taoist reclusion (Mi Fus mist-and-cloud technique). III. Ink-Brush Ethical System Materials as Ethical Statements: Raw xuan paper paired with dry-texture cun strokes metaphorizes the arduous path of benevolent rule. Colored silk works must use mineral pigments regulated by the Rites of Zhous Five Colors doctrine (blue, red, yellow, white, black). Stroke Ethics and Social Hierarchy: Scholars use hemp-fiber strokes (pima cun) for cultivated ease; fishermen/hermits employ axe-cut strokes (fupi cun) to signify unyielding integrity. IV. Semiotic Codex Inscriptions: Must be original poetry/prose with ‚â•30% quotations from Analects or allusions from Selections of Refined Literature; calligraphy in running/grass script compositionally adapted, but imperial examination (guange) style banned. Seal Protocol: Introductory Seals (Yinshou Zhang) in vermillion style modeled on Qin-Han imperial seals; Corner Seals (Yajiao Zhang) as white-character seals emulating Han official seal-carving. V. Anomaly Accommodation Clause (post-Ming unconventional literati works, e.g., Bada Shanren): Distorted forms permitted if deformations align intertextually with inscriptions (e.g., fish/birds with side-eyes mirroring protest poetry); negative space (liubai) must exceed 40% to preserve Daoist emptiness contains turbulence tension. VI. Digital Age Adaptations AI-generated works must simulate Dong Yuans fangtou cun randomness in brushwork algorithms and follow Record of Artisans chromatic sequence (blue adjacent to white) in RGB channels; prohibitions include any 3D volumetric rendering and Photoshop filters‚Äîink gradations must arise from iterative algorithms. VII. Final Validation Standards Translation must pass the Qi-Appraisal Test (period style identifiable from three meters) and the Painting-Reading Test (calligraphers reverse-engineer composition logic from inscriptions). Default technical manual: Ming-era Ten Bamboo Studio Manual; philosophical basis: Qing Principles of Painting. This translation preserves Confucian rigor, introduces executable metrics (30% Analects quota, 40% liubai), accommodates historical exceptions within orthodoxy, and bridges classical ethics to AI-generated art constraints.
